title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 1. These Regulations are the Ear-cropping of Dogs Regulations 2023 and
text_raw:
1. These Regulations are the Ear-cropping of Dogs Regulations 2023 and 

come into operation on 1st September 2023. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 regulation ear-cropping dog regulation 2023 come operation 1st september 2023 definition

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: In these Regulations-

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 3. These Regulations apply to the possession, importation, sale or supply of
text_raw:
3. These Regulations apply to the possession, importation, sale or supply of 
a dog where all or part of the ear of the dog has been removed, whether the 
removal occurred before or after the commencement of these Regulations. 

Restriction on possession
text_norm: 3 regulation apply possession importation sale supply dog part ear dog removed whether removal occurred commencement regulation restriction possession

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 4. A person shall not have a dog mentioned in Regulation 3 in his or her
text_raw:
4. A person shall not have a dog mentioned in Regulation 3 in his or her 
possession or under his or her control where the removal of all or part of the ear 
of the dog occurred after the commencement of these Regulations unless the 
person has in their possession or under their control either a copy of the licence, 
the certificate referred to in Regulation 6(b) or a record mentioned in Regulation 
9 that relates to the Dog. 

Restriction on import
text_norm: 4 person shall dog mentioned regulation 3 possession control removal part ear dog occurred commencement regulation unless person possession control either copy licence certificate referred regulation 6(b) record mentioned regulation 9 relates dog restriction import

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 5. (1) A person shall not import, or cause or permit another person to import,
text_raw:
5. (1) A person shall not import, or cause or permit another person to import, 

a dog mentioned in Regulation 3 except in accordance with a licence. 

(2) The Minister may grant a licence to the owner of a dog mentioned in 
Regulation 3 that has had its ears removed or partly removed by a veterinary 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 25th August, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [412] 3 

practitioner for the diagnosis or treatment of injury, disease or infection, attach 
conditions to the licence, vary or revoke a condition, revoke a licence or refuse 
an application. 

(3) An application for a licence shall be in a form and contain any 

information that the Minister requires. 

(4) Without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (2), the Minister may 

refuse an application or revoke a licence if, in his or her opinion— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

it is not accompanied by the fee (if any) set under section 73 of 
the Act, 

the ear of the dog was not removed or partly removed by a 
veterinary practitioner in the course of diagnosis or treatment of 
injury, disease or infection, 

the dog will not be kept by the owner at his or her normal place 
of residence, 

the applicant or person to whom the licence is granted has 
committed an offence under the Act or Regulations made under 
the European Communities Act 1972 that relate to the animal, 

the applicant or person to whom a licence is granted has failed to 
comply with a condition of a licence, or 

in relation to an application, information required has not been 
furnished or information that is false or misleading in a material 
respect has been furnished. 

(5) If the Minister proposes to refuse an application or revoke a licence, he 

or she shall— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

notify the applicant or person to whom the licence has been 
granted of the proposal and the reasons for the proposal, and that 
he or she may make representations in relation to the proposal to 
the Minister within 14 days of the date of issue of the notification, 

consider a representation duly made before deciding whether to 
proceed with, or annul the proposal, and 

notify the applicant or person to whom the licence has been 
granted of the decision and the reasons for the decision. 

(6) A person who operates, or is in control of, a vessel, vehicle or aircraft 
shall not use the vessel, vehicle or aircraft to import a dog mentioned in 
Regulation 3 unless a licence has been granted to the owner mentioned in 
paragraph (1). 

Further provisions relating to import

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 6. A person shall not import, or cause or permit another person to import, a
text_raw:
6. A person shall not import, or cause or permit another person to import, a 

dog mentioned in Regulation 3 unless – 

(a) 

the owner has given at least five days advance notice of the import 
in a manner determined by the Minister, and 

 
 
 4 [412] 

(b) 

the dog is accompanied by a certificate, in a form that the Minister 
determines, issued by a veterinarian in the place of origin attesting 
that the ears of the dog were removed or partly removed for a 
specified veterinary purpose. 

Restriction on sale or supply
text_norm: 6 person shall import cause permit another person import dog mentioned regulation 3 unless - (a) owner given least five day advance notice import manner determined minister 4 412 (b) dog accompanied certificate form minister determines issued veterinarian place origin attesting ear dog removed partly removed specified veterinary purpose restriction sale supply

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 7. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a person shall not sell or supply a dog whose
text_raw:
7. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a person shall not sell or supply a dog whose 

ears have been cropped. 

(2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to organisations specified in a list referred 

to in paragraph (3). 

(3) The Minister shall establish and maintain in a manner that he or she 
considers appropriate, a list of exempted organisations involved in the rehoming 
of dogs, which organisations shall be registered animal welfare charities. 

(4) The list referred to in paragraph (3) shall be published on a website 
maintained by the Minister and notice of the list, or amendments to the list, shall 
be published in Iris Oifigiúil. 

Restriction on possession, etc. of equipment
text_norm: 7 (1) subject paragraph (2) person shall sell supply dog whose ear cropped (2) paragraph (1) apply organisation specified list referred paragraph (3) (3) minister shall establish maintain manner considers appropriate list exempted organisation involved rehoming dog organisation shall registered animal welfare charity (4) list referred paragraph (3) shall published website maintained minister notice list amendment list shall published iris oifigiuil restriction possession etc equipment

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 8. (1) A person shall not, on any land or premises, where animals are kept,
text_raw:
8. (1) A person shall not, on any land or premises, where animals are kept, 
have an instrument or other equipment presented, made or adapted for use in 
cropping the ear of a dog in his or her possession or under his or her control. 

(2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to the possession of an instrument or other 
equipment to which that paragraph refers by a veterinary practitioner on land or 
premises used by him or her in a professional capacity. 

(3) A person shall not sell or supply an instrument or other equipment 
presented, made or adapted for use in cropping the ear of a dog to a person other 
than a veterinary practitioner. 

Provision of record
text_norm: 8 (1) person shall land premise animal kept instrument equipment presented made adapted use cropping ear dog possession control (2) paragraph (1) apply possession instrument equipment paragraph refers veterinary practitioner land premise used professional capacity (3) person shall sell supply instrument equipment presented made adapted use cropping ear dog person veterinary practitioner provision record

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 9. (1) A veterinary practitioner who removes all or part of the ear of a dog
text_raw:
9. (1) A veterinary practitioner who removes all or part of the ear of a dog 
to diagnose, or treat an injury, disease or infection shall give to the owner of the 
dog a record of that fact in a form determined by the Minister. 

(2) Where an animal welfare organisation specified in the list referred to in 
section 7 (3) sells or supplies a dog with cropped ears, they shall give to the new 
owner of the dog a record of the sale or supply in a form determined by the 
Minister. 

Maintenance of certificate and record
text_norm: 9 (1) veterinary practitioner remove part ear dog diagnose treat injury disease infection shall give owner dog record fact form determined minister (2) animal welfare organisation specified list referred section 7 (3) sell supply dog cropped ear shall give new owner dog record sale supply form determined minister maintenance certificate record

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 10. Where a dog mentioned in Regulation 3 was imported, sold or supplied
text_raw:
10. Where a dog mentioned in Regulation 3 was imported, sold or supplied 
subject to Regulation 7(2) or had its ears removed or partly removed by a 
veterinary practitioner following the commencement of these Regulations, the 
owner shall maintain the certificate referred to in Regulation 6(b), or record 

 
 
 
 
 
 [412] 5 

referred to in Regulation 9, as the case may be, relating to the dog and make it 
available for inspection on request to an authorised officer. 

Prohibition on showing
text_norm: 10 dog mentioned regulation 3 imported sold supplied subject regulation 7(2) ear removed partly removed veterinary practitioner following commencement regulation owner shall maintain certificate referred regulation 6(b) record 412 5 referred regulation 9 case may relating dog make available inspection request authorised officer prohibition showing

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 11. The owner or occupier of land or premises shall not cause or permit a
text_raw:
11. The owner or occupier of land or premises shall not cause or permit a 
dog whose ears have been cropped to be present at an event where dogs are 
shown, compete or are used in connection with a sporting or cultural activity. 

Penal provisions
text_norm: 11 owner occupier land premise shall cause permit dog whose ear cropped present event dog shown compete used connection sporting cultural activity penal provision

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: 12. Regulations 4, 5(1) and (6), 6, 7(1), 8(1) and (3), 10 and 11 are penal
text_raw:
12. Regulations 4, 5(1) and (6), 6, 7(1), 8(1) and (3), 10 and 11 are penal 

provisions to which section 36 (4) (b) of the Act applies. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 August, 2023. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [412]

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and having regard to Article 36
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Statutory Instrument strengthens existing restrictions on the practice of 
cropping the ears of dogs. This Instrument specifically restricts the possession 
or control of dogs with cropped ears, the sale or supply of dogs with cropped 
ears, the import of dogs with cropped ears and the possession, sale or supply of 
equipment used to crop the ears of dogs, and prohibits the showing of dogs with 
cropped ears. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [412] 7
